adjectives.description: doomed (comparative more doomed, superlative most doomed)

entries.meaning: Assured to suffer death, failure, or a similarly negative outcome.
(archaic) Assured of any outcome, whether positive or negative; fated.
examples: Bonny Mary Burnet was lost. She left her father's house at nine o'clock on a Wednesday morning, 17th of September, neatly dressed in a white jerkin and green bonnet, with her hay-raik over her shoulder; and that was the last sight she was doomed ever to see of her native cottage.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of doom
